newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen stable.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen stable.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed 0.03 down at 42.63 to the dollar in the kerb market on Sunday amid a rise in demand for dollars near close.

They said lower rates of the dollar at open attracted buying from near close. "The rupee may open steady at current levels as the supply of dollars is enough to fulfil the rise in demand," one dealer said.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on October 22, was 40.1200/40.3206 rupees to the dollar.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed steady at 6.50 percent. -- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
